laboratory_examinations.findings: Abdominal aortic aneurysm measures up to 4.6 cm in greatest dimension, compared to 5.2 cm previously. The gallbladder contains a calculus in the gallbladder neck, measuring approximately 6 mm, and a tiny gallbladder polyp. No gallbladder wall edema or pericholecystic edema. Gallbladder wall is not thickened. No perihepatic ascites. The main portal vein is patent. The common duct measures 3 mm.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The abdominal aortic aneurysm size decreased from 5.2 cm to 4.6 cm, although the difference in measurements is likely due to different techniques.
